concept.title: Configuring log files
concept.shortdesc: You can set the logging level, view the logging level, change the log location, and view log location information by using . You can also configure log rotation in a Docker environment by using Docker commands and modifying a sample log rotation file.

conbody.p:
By default, provides several logs files:
-default.log This log file shows all log entries about the operation of the server. High severity entries that are shown in other logs are also logged in the -default.log.
-connection.log This log file shows log entries that are related to connections. These entries can be used as an audit log for connections, and also indicates errors with connections.
-security.log This log file shows log entries that are related to authentication and authorization. This log can be used as an audit log for security-related items.
-admin.log This log file shows log entries that are related to running administration commands. It records all changes to the configuration of the , and attempted changes.
-mqconnectivity.log This log file shows log entries that are related to function. These entries include problems found connecting to queue managers. The log can help diagnose problems in connecting to .
The log files have different logging levels that determine the number of messages are that logged. For more information about the levels, and how to set the logging level, see .

Log location can be a file or a syslog server. You can change log location for each of these components and view the log location information by using . For more information about changing and displaying log location, see .

You can specify syslog server configuration and view information about existing syslog server configuration by using . For more information about configuring and viewing syslog server information, see .
